snippet: YouTube, Facebook and Twitter have made it easier for South Korean pop music bands to reach audiences in the West, and fans are using the same social networks to proclaim their devotion.
abstract: YouTube, Facebook and Twitter are making it easier for South Korean pop music bands to reach audiences in the West, and fans are using the same social networks to proclaim their devotion; K-pop is part of a broader trend known as the Korean Wave.

byline.original: By CHOE SANG-HUN and MARK RUSSELL
byline.contributor: Choe Sang-hun reported from Seoul, and Mark Russell reported from Barcelona, Spain.

lead_paragraph: YouTube, Facebook and Twitter have made it easier for South Korean pop music bands to reach audiences in the West, and fans are using the same social networks to proclaim their devotion.

headline.seo: Using Social Media to Bring Korean Pop Music to the West
